StratmasClient
Class Debug

java.lang.Object
  StratmasClient.Debug

public class Debug
extends Object

Debug is a class used for debug operations of different kinds. The point of the class is to allow easy on and off switching of, for instance, debug outputs and options.

Field Summary
static PrintStream err
          The debug output stream.
static boolean isInDebugMode
          Are we in debugMode or not?.

Method Summary
static void addDebugAction(Action action)
          Adds a debug action that will be visible in debug frames.

          Adds a debug component that will be visible in debug frames.
static void createDebugFrame()
          Creates a debug frame exposing the debug actions.
static JPanel createDebugPanel()
          Returns a panel containing whatever controls are needed for debugging.
static void disableDebugMode()
          Puts application out of debug mode.
static void enableDebugMode()
          Puts application in debug mode.
static StackTraceElement getCaller()
          Returns the StackTraceElement of the calling method of the calling method, or null if no such method.
static Vector getDebugActions()
          Returns a vector of debug actions.
static Vector getDebugComponents()
          Returns a vector of debug actions.
static StackTraceElement getOutsideCaller()
          Returns the StackTraceElement of the first function that is defined outside the calling class, or null if none.
static boolean isInDebugMode()
          Returns true if in debug mode.

Adds a debug component that will be visible in debug frames. NOTE: it is much preferable to, if possible, define an action instead.

Parameters:
component - compoenent to add.
